entry.title: chaos, crowned.
entry.summary:
Author: lastbudnotleast

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,762Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 65

Summary: "So here I am, at probably the worst school in the country. Whose alumni are nothing but arms dealers, serial killers, and corporate lawyers. Real scum. And that old creep thinks he can tame me? We shall see, my friend. I only give people what they have coming to them." - Tim DrakeTim knew from the start that enrolling in Gotham Academy would be pure hell—and he was right. Every hallway, every sneer, every shadow confirmed it. But everything shifted the moment he met Damian Wayne. Something in him changed, though whether for better or worse, even he couldn’t say.

entry.title: Finding Tim Drake
entry.summary:
Author: Chaotic_evil_stuff

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 422,323Chapters: 117/150Kudos: 703

Summary: Tim returns to Gotham after long time with the Titans to focus more on Tim Drake rather than Red Robin and regain some normality. Damian, now 20 years old, has developed some respect for Tim in his absence. He tries his very best to make Tim feel welcomed. The fresh start for both boys allows them to become more than rivals, and much more than friends too.Their relationship unfolds as their lives change for better, for worse and with new (and unexpected) additions to their daily life. How will they manage them, and how will it change them?  This is part 1 of my series and is still ongoing and updated regularly. Smut is on separate chapters, so if you're not into that, this can be read without it and still have a full cohesive story.

entry.title: Unequivocally (perhaps the greener grass isn't grass at all)
entry.summary:
Author: singformeangel

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,005Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 181

Summary: Desperate to prove his superiority (and thoroughly disgusted by Drake's continuous lack of self-preservation) Damian sets out to obtain picture evidence of Drake's inadequacy. Diligence and pertinacity lead Damian to a golden opportunity--his phone poised and ready to capture Drake in the act of hiding yet another injury, but the resulting photograph captures far more than a self-destructive white lie.Furious, Damian launches a one-man inquisition, uncovering a truth far more nuanced and dark than he could have ever expected, and he finds himself questioning far more than just Timothy Jackson Drake's sanity.

Summary: “Like what?” he asked, his voice deliberately low, his breath ghosting over Tim’s face. Tim didn’t answer right away. Instead, his fingers slipped under the hem of Damian’s shirt, tracing a slow, calculated path along his skin. Every touch was intentional, a deliberate attempt to crack the perfect mask of control Damian wore so well. “Submissive,” Tim whispered the word like a secret. And it was — a forbidden intimacy between two boys, especially two who were, at least on paper, brothers. Tim didn’t care about that now.
